Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that holds all of a player's Item objects that they currently own. These items can then have a total weight, total gold, and total quantity of each item printed so the player can know what they have in their inventory for selling purposes.
    Version:
    20160827
    Author:
    Taner Davis

      void addItem(Item i)
      Add a single item object to the player's inventory.

      Extend the size of the internal items array by 10 each time this is called.

      Retrieve the array that constitutes the player's inventory

      Returns the total number of items inside the player's inventory.

      When the user requires the inventory to be printed out, model it in the style of a dialogue prompt of an RPG

    • Field Detail

      • items

        private Item[] items
        Item array to hold all of a player's items. The Item array acts as an ArrayList where it can increase in size as needed.

      • currentIndex

        private int currentIndex
        The next empty location in the items array. Used to store the next item the player acquires.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Default Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • extendArray

        private void extendArray(int oldSize)
        Extend the size of the internal items array by 10 each time this is called.
        Parameters:
        oldSize - The prior size of the array

      • addItem

        public void addItem(Item i)
        Add a single item object to the player's inventory.
        Parameters:
        i - The single item to be added to the player's inventory.

      • getTotalPrice

        public int getTotalPrice()
        Returns the value, in gold, of all items inside a player's inventory.
        Returns:
        The sum of price for all items in the player's inventory

      • getTotalWeight

        public double getTotalWeight()
        Returns the total weight of all items in the player's inventory.
        Returns:
        The sum of weight for all items in the player's inventory.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the total number of items inside the player's inventory.
        Returns:
        The number of items currently in the player's inventory.

      • weighItemsByName

        public double weighItemsByName(java.lang.String name)
        Loop over all the items in the player's inventory and weigh the ones that have the same name as the parameter
        Parameters:
        name - Name of items to calculate weight.
        Returns:
        Total weight of all items in the player's inventory with a specified name.

      • priceItemsByName

        public int priceItemsByName(java.lang.String name)
        Loop over all the Items in the player's inventory and sum the price of the ones that have the same name as the parameter
        Parameters:
        name - Name of items to calculate weight.
        Returns:
        Total weight of all items in the player's inventory with a specified name.

      • getItems

        public Item[] getItems()
        Retrieve the array that constitutes the player's inventory
        Returns:
        The Item array that is the player's inventory

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        When the user requires the inventory to be printed out, model it in the style of a dialogue prompt of an RPG
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representing the information stored in the Inventory class.
